metadata.title: CVE-2014-4260 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Unspecified vulnerability in the MySQL Server component in Oracle MySQL5.5.37 and earlier, and 5.6.17 and earlier, allows remote authenticatedusers to affect integrity and availability via vectors related to SRCHAR.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-4260` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient18 - 5.5.38-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libmysqld-pic - 5.5.38-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-client - 5.5.38-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-client-5.5 - 5.5.38-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-client-core-5.5 - 5.5.38-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-common - 5.5.38-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-server - 5.5.38-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-server-5.5 - 5.5.38-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-server-core-5.5 - 5.5.38-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-source-5.5 - 5.5.38-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-testsuite - 5.5.38-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-testsuite-5.5 - 5.5.38-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

mysql-client-5.6 - 5.6.19-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-client-core-5.6 - 5.6.19-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-common-5.6 - 5.6.19-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-server-5.6 - 5.6.19-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-server-core-5.6 - 5.6.19-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-source-5.6 - 5.6.19-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mysql-testsuite-5.6 - 5.6.19-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

libmariadbclient18 - 5.5.39-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-client - 5.5.39-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-client-5.5 - 5.5.39-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-client-core-5.5 - 5.5.39-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-common - 5.5.39-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-server - 5.5.39-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-server-5.5 - 5.5.39-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-server-core-5.5 - 5.5.39-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-test - 5.5.39-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
mariadb-test-5.5 - 5.5.39-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mysql-5.5 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.5.38-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
mysql-5.6 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.6.19-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
mariadb-5.5 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.5.39-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
